disobedience.question: Was I disobedient to my parents in my interactions with them?
disobedience.description: As per the fourth commandment, it's a child's duty to respond to parental love, wisdom, and respect with obedience.

extracted_data_phrases: as a reflection on the Church 's divine nature
disobedience.question: Did you reject the unity of the Church when experiencing frustration with members, viewing their human imperfections as a reflection on the Church's divine nature?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

extracted_data_phrases: during designated days , such as Ash Wednesday
disobedience.question: Did I intentionally skip fasting during designated days, such as Ash Wednesday?

extracted_data_phrases: during days when it is obligatory , such as on Ash Wednesday

disobedience.question: Did I condone a funeral where human remains were not properly buried, thereby disrespecting the dignity of the deceased?
disobedience.description: Failing to advocate for proper burial of human remains is considered sinful as the Church teaches that the body is sacred and deserves reverent burial, with scattering or keeping remains being contrary to the dignity of the human body and resurrection belief.

disobedience.question: Did you use words to disparage the Church?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

extracted_data_phrases: on a Sunday when it otherwise could have been avoided , thus showing disrespect for the Lord 's day of rest

disobedience.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).
